eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DiscordRichPresence
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds discord rich presence to your games.
description: Allows adding discord rich presence to your games. Only works on Windows/Mac/Linux exports. To test it on a preview, restart the discord desktop client while GDevelop is already opened, and start a preview.
You can get more infos on each field via [the discord documentation](https://discord.com/developers/docs/rich-presence/how-to#updating-presence-update-presence-payload-fields).

eventsFunctions.description: Attempts to connect to discord if it is installed, and initialize rich presence.
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectToDiscord

eventsFunctions.description: Update the data in the rich presence. See the discord documentation for more info on each field. Each field except state is optional.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateRichPresence
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update rich presence to state _PARAM1_, details _PARAM2_, begin timestamp _PARAM3_, end timestamp _PARAM4_, large image _PARAM5_ with text _PARAM6_ and small image _PARAM7_ with text _PARAM8_

parameters.description: The details of the current state
parameters.name: details

parameters.description: The timstamp of the start of the match
parameters.longDescription: If this is filled, discord will show the time elapsed since the start.
parameters.name: startTimestamp

parameters.description: The timestamp of the end of the match
parameters.longDescription: If this is filled, discord will display the remaining time.
parameters.name: endTimestamp

parameters.description: The name of the big image
parameters.name: largeImageKey

parameters.description: The text of the large image
parameters.name: largeImageText

parameters.description: The name of the small image
parameters.name: smallImageKey

parameters.description: The text of the small image
parameters.name: smallImageText

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteSlider
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
description: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value. The slider can be customized with sprites.
There are ready-to-use sliders in the asset-store [settings UI pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=settings-ui-settings-ui).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Represent a value on a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Slider

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteSlider

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label that is displayed over the thumb.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

parameters: max(Background.BoundingBoxRight(), max(Label.BoundingBoxRight(), Thumb.BoundingBoxRight())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxLeft(), min(Label.BoundingBoxLeft(), Thumb.BoundingBoxLeft()))
max(Background.BoundingBoxBottom(), max(Label.BoundingBoxBottom(), Thumb.BoundingBoxBottom())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxTop(), min(Label.BoundingBoxTop(), Thumb.BoundingBoxTop()))

events.comment: The parent size is not defined in onCreate so it needs to be done here.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.
description: Toggle switch that users can click or touch. The switch can be customized with sprites.
There are ready-to-use toggle switches in the asset-store [settings UI pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=settings-ui-settings-ui).

eventsFunctions.description: Check (or uncheck) the toggle switch.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
description: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.
Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CursorHover

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

inlineCode: // Set cursor to behavior property cursor_type

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: cursor_type

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Drag camera with the mouse (or touchscreen)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
How to use:
- Run this action on every frame that you want the camera to be movable by the mouse (or touchscreen)
- Select the mouse button to use (choose "left" for touchscreen)
- Select which directions the camera will move (vertical, horizontal, or both)
- Select the layer that will be moved
Tips:
- If no parameters are selected, the camera will move in both directions when the left mouse button (or touchscreen) are dragged.

eventsFunctions.description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ directions using _PARAM4_ mouse button

events.comment: When mouse button is pressed, get starting position of mouse
When mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
If selected direction is horizontal, both, or left blank, move camera on X axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel
If direction is vertical, both, or left blank, move camera on Y axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel

parameters.description: Directions that the camera can move (horizontal, vertical, both)
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
description: Enables players to click and drag on physics objects to move them.  The object retains velocity when the click is released, allowing players to fling objects across the screen.
Note:
- The default "draggable" behavior will not work on objects with the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
- Kinematic physics mode is incompatible with this extension. The object will be changed to dynamic mode.
The Parking Jam example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://parking-jam)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggablePhysics

events.comment: Create mouse joints and save the joint ID
Delete the mouse joint
Update the position of the mouse joint to follow the mouse

eventsFunctions.description: the joint frequency (per second) of the object.

eventsFunctions.description: the joint damping ratio (range: 0 to 1) of the object.
